q: Éric Besson , the french minister charged with administering public projects, on wednesday called on private investors to help in the country's bid to host the european championships in 2016. in a report Éric Besson said it was vital to encourage private investment in public stadia and to have recourse to public-private partnerships. Éric Besson stressed the need to increase the competitiveness of french sporting venues, adding that he wanted local government to "finance all or part the service and access roads to stadiums." the report, wide ranging in

"as this financial panic eases, we may see the canadian dollar rebound rather quickly." investors appear to have regained confidence in global markets, allowing other currencies to rise against the dollar. central banks just threw enough mud at the wall until something stuck, and for whatever reason, it stuck at the end of last month, said Shane Enright , a currency strategist with cibc world markets in toronto. "at first, we saw investors around the world wanting nothing but the u.s. dollar. but now they want almost everything outside of the u.s.
